paper_metadata.title: Solubility limit and annealing effects on the microstructure & thermoelectric properties of Fe2V1−xTaxAl1−ySiy Heusler compounds

scope_check.purpose: Determine the solubility limits of Ta and Si in full-Heusler Fe2V1− xTaxAl1−ySiy, understand annealing effects on microstructure, and link these to thermoelectric transport.
scope_check.approach: Bulk alloys were synthesized by RF induction melting and vacuum annealing, then characterized by powder XRD (Rietveld), SEM/EDX. Selected compositions underwent additional long-term and high-temperature anneals. Seebeck coefficient, electrical resistivity, and thermal conductivity were measured over wide T ranges and analyzed using transport models (triple-parabolic band; Callaway model for lattice thermal conductivity). :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

figures.caption_summary: Powder XRD patterns of Fe2V1−xTaxAl1−ySiy after 1073 K, 168 h anneal; impurity peaks of hexagonal Fe2Ta-type Laves phase (C14) grow with Ta and Si; lattice parameter vs x and y showing deviations at solubility limit.

subfigures.caption_summary: XRD patterns showing diminished (111) peak (B2/CsCl-type disorder) and emergence of Fe2Ta (C14) peaks with increasing x and y.
Room-temperature lattice parameter a vs composition; linear trends with deviations at x=0.1,y=0.1 and x=0.15,y=0 indicating solubility limit.

figures.caption_summary: SEM microstructures at solubility border: Fe2V0.9Ta0.1Al shows diffuse contrast and nanoscale precipitates (metastable supersaturated Heusler); Fe2V0.9Ta0.1Al0.9Si0.1 shows lamellar impurity phase.

subfigures.caption_summary: Fe2V0.9Ta0.1Al (1073 K, 168 h): diffuse contrast indicating metastable, oversaturated Heusler.
Fe2V0.9Ta0.1Al0.9Si0.1 (1073 K, 168 h): large amount of lamella-shaped impurity.
Magnified view of Fig.2a showing nanoscale precipitates (few 10^−7 m scale).
Magnified view of Fig.2b highlighting lamellar morphology.

figures.caption_summary: SEM/EDX of Fe2V1−xTaxAl for x=0.1, 0.15, 0.2 showing that Ta content in Heusler matrix saturates; further Ta increases secondary phase fraction.
Solubility map of Fe2V1−xTaxAl1−ySiy from XRD and SEM: single-phase vs impurity-bearing regions; Al/Si substitution reduces Ta solubility.

SEM of Fe2V0.95Ta0.05Al0.9Si0.1 after different annealing histories: evolution from diffuse contrast to punctiform precipitates, to connected/grain-boundary segregated, to fine lamellar/dendritic secondary phase with longer anneals.

subfigures.caption_summary: LT short (1073 K, 168 h): diffuse contrasts, small unconnected precipitates.
HT short (additional 1373 K, 48 h + 1273 K, 120 h; total 336 h): evenly dispersed punctiform precipitates (nanoscale).
HT long (total 399 h): precipitates grow/connect; grain boundary segregation and grainlike impurity regions.
LT long (additional 744 h at 1073 K; total 912 h): dendrite-like precipitates; fine lamellar microstructure intertwined in Heusler.
Additional LT long view highlighting eutectic-like lamellae.

figures.caption_summary: Temperature-dependent transport of Fe2V0.95Ta0.05Al0.9Si0.1 for different anneals: Seebeck S(T), resistivity ρ(T), thermal conductivity λ(T), and ZT(T); model fits included.

subfigures.caption_summary: Seebeck coefficient vs temperature with tripleparabolic model fits.

graphs.notes: Multiple annealing conditions plotted (LT short, HT short, HT long, LT long).
Pronounced maxima shift with annealing; metallic channels from secondary phase reduce |S| and ρ. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

subfigures.caption_summary: Thermal conductivity vs temperature; λe removed via Wiedemann–Franz to analyze λlatt with Callaway model; radiation correction (RT^3) applied.

graphs.notes: Lowest λ for HT short across the range; λ_300K down to ~4.1 W m^-1 K^-1 in LT long after correction. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

subfigures.caption_summary: ZT vs temperature derived from measured S, ρ, λ; peak ZT≈0.3–0.34 near 300 K (HT short).

graphs.notes: ZT increased despite reduced |S| due to lowered λ; highest reported for bulk Fe2VAl-type at RT in this work. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

figures.caption_summary: Phenomenological evolution of band structure from fits: apparent band gap decreases with annealing, reflecting metallic-like influence of secondary phase in effective single-phase analysis.

samples_common.morphology: Polycrystalline bulk ingots; rectangular bars (2×2×10 mm) cut for transport; powders ground for XRD.

microstructure.other: Heusler L21 matrix with antisite (B2/CsCl-type) disorder common after 1073 K/168 h; secondary hexagonal Fe2Ta-type (C14) Laves phase appears beyond solubility; precipitates evolve from nanoscale dots to lamellae/dendrites with prolonged annealing. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

synthesis.method: RF induction melting of high-purity elements; multiple remelts for homogeneity; vacuum quartz-tube anneal; furnace cool.
synthesis.equipment: Radio frequency induction furnace; quartz tubes; vacuum pump.
synthesis.conditions: Base pressure ≈1e-5 mbar; standard anneal 1073 K for 168 h (6.048e5 s); additional sequences for selected samples: HT short 1373 K for 48 h (1.728e5 s) + 1273 K for 120 h (4.32e5 s); HT long 1373 K for 48 h (1.728e5 s) + 1273 K for 183 h (6.588e5 s); LT long extra 744 h (2.6784e6 s) at 1073 K resulting in 912 h (3.2832e6 s) total. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

measurement.methods: Powder XRD with Rietveld refinement; SEM imaging; EDX for composition mapping; four-probe dc Seebeck/resistivity (300–800 K) and ac Seebeck (4–300 K); steady-state thermal conductivity in helium-cooled flow cryostat (8–300 K); Callaway model fits with radiation correction; Wiedemann–Franz for λe.
measurement.equipment: XRD: Siemens D5000, PANalytical X’Pert Pro MPD, Rigaku SmartLab; SEM: JSM-IT100, Quanta 250 FEG; Seebeck/ρ: ADVANCE RIKO ZEM1 & ZEM3; cryostat setup for λ(T).
measurement.conditions: Seebeck/resistivity measured from 4–800 K; thermal conductivity from 8–300 K under high vacuum; radiation correction term RT^3 used in analysis. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

samples_common.other_factors: Antisite disorder increased in powders by grinding; annealing temperature strongly affects L21 ordering and (111) superlattice reflection; Al/Si co-substitution reduces Ta solubility. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

samples.crystal_structure: Full-Heusler (L21) with B2/CsCl-type disorder; secondary hexagonal Fe2Ta-type (C14) at/near solubility limit.

sample_specific.morphology: Bulk polycrystal; nanoscale impurity precipitates (few 1e-7 m) from oversaturated regions.

microstructure.other: Metastable supersaturated Heusler with diffuse SEM contrast; onset of Fe2Ta-type impurity precipitation. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

synthesis.conditions: 1073 K for 168 h (6.048e5 s), vacuum ≈1e-5 mbar; furnace cooled. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

sample_specific.other_factors: Estimated Ta solubility around x≈0.073 in Fe2V1−xTaxAl (y=0). :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}

samples.crystal_structure: Full-Heusler (L21/B2) matrix with significant lamellar secondary phase (Fe2Ta-type).

sample_specific.morphology: Lamella-shaped impurity regions indicating reduced Ta solubility with Si substitution.

microstructure.other: Thermal equilibrium with sizable Laves phase fraction; strong lamellar morphology. :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

synthesis.conditions: 1073 K for 168 h (6.048e5 s), vacuum ≈1e-5 mbar. :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}

microstructure.other: Oversaturated regions in Heusler matrix; starting point of annealing series. :contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}

synthesis.conditions: 1073 K for 168 h (6.048e5 s), vacuum ≈1e-5 mbar. :contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}

sample_specific.other_factors: High reported PF previously for this composition due to band engineering; here used to study microstructural evolution. :contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}

samples.crystal_structure: Full-Heusler matrix + small, evenly dispersed punctiform precipitates.

microstructure.other: Effective phonon scattering; lowest λ(T) across range among conditions. :contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}

synthesis.method: LT short followed by high-T anneals.
synthesis.conditions: Post-LT: 1373 K for 48 h (1.728e5 s) + 1273 K for 120 h (4.32e5 s); total ageing 336 h (1.2096e6 s). :contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}

sample_specific.other_factors: ZT≈0.3–0.34 at 300 K; PF remains high (~7 mW m^-1 K^-2) while λ reduced. :contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}

samples.crystal_structure: Full-Heusler matrix with dendrite-like/lamellar secondary phase (coarser).

sample_specific.morphology: Fine lamellar/eutectic-like microstructure with larger precipitates after long anneal.

microstructure.other: λ_300K can reach ~4.1 W m^-1 K^-1 after radiation correction; larger precipitates reduce scattering effectiveness vs HT short. :contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}

synthesis.method: LT short followed by extended LT anneal.
synthesis.conditions: Additional 744 h (2.6784e6 s) at 1073 K; total 912 h (3.2832e6 s). :contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}

sample_specific.other_factors: Transport indicates metallic-like contribution from secondary phase; maxima in S(T), ρ(T) shift to higher T. :contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}

samples.crystal_structure: Full-Heusler matrix with increased Fe2Ta-type secondary phase fraction.

sample_specific.morphology: More secondary phase with dendrite/lamella-like morphology at higher Ta.

microstructure.other: EDX shows Ta content in matrix saturates near ~0.07; excess Ta forms secondary phase. :contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}

synthesis.conditions: 1073 K for 168 h (6.048e5 s), vacuum ≈1e-5 mbar. :contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}

sample_specific.other_factors: Supports solubility limit x≈0.073 in Fe2V1−xTaxAl (y=0). :contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}
